title: Unsustainable transmission charges could jeopardise British infrastructure investment warns report
lead: Green energy infrastructure investment is being jeopardised by British regulations that favour EU electricity imports.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BEIS unveils £166m to encourage 'rapid development' of CCUS and hydrogen
lead: Over 60,000 green jobs are to be created as the result of £166.5 million of funding announced today (24 May) by the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS).
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ofgem looks to support EV rollout as it announces winning projects receiving £300m
lead: ​Over 200 low carbon projects are getting a chunk of £300 million in investment from Ofgem to support electric transport and heat.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ENGIE seals deal with Asda to rollout EV charging at 19 Yorkshire sites
lead: ​ENGIE is to install 50kW+ electric vehicle (EV) chargers at 19 Asda locations in West Yorkshire as part of a new partnership.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Fulcrum signs its largest smart meter contract worth £20m with supplier E
lead: ​Fulcrum is to manage 320,000 meter points as part of what is its largest smart meter contract to date.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Changeable British weather could risk grid security argues new report
lead: ​Increasingly changeable weather in Britain could put net zero and the security of the electricity grid at risk according to a new report.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Chats: ENA’s Alex Howison on the need for a common agreement for flexibility services
lead: Current± caught up with Alex Howison, part of ENA’s Open Networks flexibility services product team and flexible solutions manager at Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks about the challenges of bringing in a common agreement, the framework approach and the need for greater flexibility to enable decarbonisation.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem survey finds EV owners 'more open' to embracing changes to energy usage
lead: ​Electric vehicle (EV) owners are three times more likely to say they’re on a time of use tariff than those without an EV, according to new research from Ofgem.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Europe's 'most powerful' EV charging hub to see 300kW chargers installed in Oxford
lead: ​Oxford is to be home to 38 fast and ultra-rapid electric vehicle (EV) chargers as part of a project aiming to provide a global blueprint for cities across the world.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Good Energy to access wholesale market through Vattenfall’s Energy Trader platform
lead: ​Vattenfall is set to provide supplier Good Energy with access to the long and short-term wholesale electricity market through its Energy Trader platform.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Briefings: The future of Dynamic Containment
lead: ​We’re pleased to announce the second in our Current± Briefings webinar series will welcome Mike Ryan from Habitat Energy to discuss the future of Dynamic Containment.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ENA launches new Smarter Networks Portal to simplify innovation
lead: ​The Energy Networks Association (ENA) is aiming to make innovation more accessible and transparent with the launch of a new Smarter Networks Portal.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Renewables, solar and nuclear industries call for detailed deployment roadmap for decarbonisation
lead: ​Urgent action is needed to jumpstart grid decarbonisation according to the Nuclear Industry Association, RenewableUK and Solar Energy UK.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: National Grid lauds ‘solid’ results despite £300 million COVID-19 impact
lead: ​National Grid is celebrating a reduction in the impact of COVID-19 on its underlying operating profits in a year with strong operational performance and the "transformational" acquisition of Western Power Distribution (WPD).
author: Alice Grundy

title: UK continues to rise through the ranks of EY’s RECAI
lead: ​The UK has once again moved up a spot in EY’s Renewable Energy Country Attractiveness Index (RECAI), securing the fourth spot in the rankings.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UK ETS launches with UKA Futures opening at £50
lead: ​The UK’s Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS) has opened for trading for the first time, with the carbon price coming in at £50.23.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Connected Kerb to provide councils with EV charging blueprint in 'first-of-a-kind' scheme
lead: Connected Kerb is to install 40 electric vehicle (EV) chargers in the first phase of a new scheme in partnership with Kent County Council.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Public Accounts Committee slams government's lack of plan for 'huge challenge' of EV transition
lead: ​The government has a “mountain to climb” to reach its goals of phasing out new petrol and diesel cars by 2030 and for all new cars to be zero-emission by 2035.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Flexitricity set to optimise Foresight's 50MW West Gourdie battery
lead: ​Flexitricity has been chosen by Foresight to optimise its new 49.9MW West Gourdie battery  site.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Embedding flexibility could save £16.7bn by 2050, says Carbon Trust
lead: ​Flexibility could deliver up to £16.7 billion in savings per annum in 2050 according to a new report from the Carbon Trust.
author: Molly Lempriere
